N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 17 ยง 918.1 - Installation where temporary speed restrictions are imposed

State Regulations

Whenever track conditions are such that temporary speed
restrictions are deemed necessary, every railroad corporation subject to the
jurisdiction of the commissioner, shall, in addition to all other normal
operating orders and practices, immediately install and continue to maintain
during the entire speed restricted period "Slow Speed" warning boards or signs
of suitable sizes so as to be readily visible at all times to the engineer of
an approaching train and located at a sufficient distance from the point to be
protected to insure proper reduction from maximum authorized speed to the
restricted speed as well as a similar "Resume Speed" warning board or sign
located at a point beyond the restricted speed section as to indicate where
normal speed may be safely resumed. Notes
